[[File:J.R.R._Tolkien_-_Second_Silmarillion_Map.jpg|thumb|The map in ''[[Tolkien: Maker of Middle-earth]]''.]]

'''The Second 'Silmarillion' Map''' is a map (on four sheets) drawn by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] of [[Beleriand]], dating from the early 1930s. A redrawn version of the map was reproduced by [[Christopher Tolkien]] in 1987 as an Appendix to ''[[The Lost Road and Other Writings]]''. This map was the basis for the [[Map of Beleriand and the Lands to the North]] included in ''[[The Silmarillion]]'' (1977).<ref>{{LR|A3}}, pp. 407-413</ref>

[[File:Christopher Tolkien - Second Silmarillion Map.jpg|thumb|The map in ''[[The War of the Jewels]]''.]]

''[[The War of the Jewels]]'' (1994) provided yet another reproduction of the Second 'Silmarillion' Map, featuring "subsequent alterations and additions", with commentaries on the changes.<ref>{{WJ|Beleriand}}, pp. 180-191</ref> Furthermore, Christopher reproduced in the same volume a redrawn version of a photocopy of the North-east section of the same map, kept and annotated by his father.<ref>{{WJ|Maeglin}}, pp. 330-333</ref>

The original document was reproduced for the first time in the book [[Tolkien: Maker of Middle-earth|Tolkien Maker of Middle Earth]],<ref>C. McIlwaine, ''Tolkien Maker of Middle Earth'', Bodleian Library, Oxford, 2018, p.227-229.</ref> published in 2018 and coinciding with an exhibition of the same name.

This map possesses the number 186 on the ''[https://tai.tolkienists.org/tai/186/ Tolkien Art Index]''.
